p: When studying the relationships between fire service response time and fire outcomes in New Zealand, Challands [ 56] discovered that the fraction of fires considered large, i.e., over 30 m 2, was linearly related to the response time x (minutes). The linear relationship for 27,500 structural fires gave y = 0.023 min −1·x + 0.043, i.e., 2.3% more fires had grown beyond 30 m 2 for each additional minute response time. For very dry wood fires, the relationship may be similar, but probably with a steeper slope as the fires reach flashover earlier.
